paper_title.ja: 縫製布における縫目の逆緩和現象
paper_title.en: Inverse Relaxation Phenomena of the Seam in Sewn Fabrics

description.ja: 本研究は, 縫製布における縫目の逆緩和現象に焦点を当て, 繰り返し負荷の有無や戻し率との関係を検証する目的で行った.また, 縫製布の縫目密度や糸締まり率を変えて逆緩和測定を行い, 逆緩和現象に影響を与えるのか, 比較・検討した.その結果, 縫製布の逆緩和測定では, 繰り返し負荷の有無, 縫目密度に関わらず, 緩和・ミックス緩和・逆緩和曲線が表れた.戻し率が大きくなると, 逆緩和指数も増加することが確認された.しかし, 繰り返し負荷の有無による差は不明確であった.縫製布における糸締まり率と逆緩和現象に関係性は見られなかった.縫糸1目あたりについて得られた逆緩和測定結果は, 縫製布のそれとほぼ対応した.よって縫製布の逆緩和現象を考える際に, 縫製布を「縫製部」「布部」といった視点からも検討しうることが示唆された.
description.en:
When visco-elastic materials are held stretched during extending, the stress in them gradually decays. It may drop to a limiting value or it may disappear completely. This phenomenon is known as relaxation. When their materials are held retracted during stress recovery, the stress in them may increase with time under some conditions. This phenomenon is known as inverse relaxation. We have investigated inverse relaxation on sewn fabrics at various stitch density on some stitch tightening ratios.
The relaxation, mix-relaxation and inverse relaxation were examined from the sewn fabrics with or without cycle-loading test. The inverse relaxation index was increased with increasing the force retraction. The inverse relaxation index of sewn fabrics did not correlate with the stitch tightness factor. The inverse relaxation index corresponded to that of the loop-sewing thread per unit stitch. The fact suggested that the inverse relaxation phenomena of sewn fabrics may be regarded from the linear model of fabric parts and seam parts.

paper_title.ja: New Tightness Factorによる織物構造の解析

paper_title.en: Viscoelastic properties of threads before and after sewing

description.en: The viscoelastic properties of the sewing thread before and after loading in the sewing process were investigated. Sewing threads are subjected to dynamic tension and friction in the sewing process. In order to compare polyester, cotton and silk sewing threads, the fineness of the threads were selected to be almost equal. There are some differences between the stress extension curves of the parent thread and the sewn thread except for the polyester sewing thread. The phenomenon of inverse relaxation occurs for high levels of retraction. The stress-inverse relaxation index for the polyester sewing thread is larger than for other threads and the inverse relaxation for silk thread is small. From the creep curves, the sewn threads show higher secondary creep and lower instantaneous recovery than the parent threads. © 2003, MCB UP Limited

publication_name.en: International Journal of Clothing Science and Technology
